ranking1.title: Data Analyst Team Lead
ranking1.Main Responsibilities:
Serve as a subject matter expert on business data and database structures
Analyze data analysis requests obtained from management to determine operational problems and define data modeling requirements, validation of content, and problem-solving parameters
Identify opportunities to use data to develop new strategies and improve business performance and utilize knowledge of mathematical modeling and other optimization methods to perform quantitative and qualitative data analysis
Conduct exploratory meetings with business partners to generate ideas and gather requirements around how data and reporting can be used to drive operational efficiencies, as well as new business opportunities
Communicate and present data to management by developing reports
Collaborate with other team members to build upon results to create deeper insights
Serve as mentor and problem-solver for Data Analysts by helping them resolve issues and get access to resources needed to deliver data to our customers
Conduct regular one-on-one meetings with team members and provide critical feedback as necessary to the employee, or to the Enterprise Data Warehouse Manager
Monitor workflow of Data Analysts by assigning data requests and ensuring completion dates are being met
Review completed data requests for quality before final artifacts are delivered to customers
This role directly supervises a team of data analysts
ranking1.Position Requirements:
B.S./M.S. degree in Computer Information Systems or Data Analytics, or equivalent work experience
5+ years’ experience as a report or data analyst
3+ years’ experience in a supervisory/management role with at least one direct report
Proven experience and proficiency with Excel, Power BI, and SQL Server
Strong analytical skills
Strong team-building skills
Detail-oriented with the ability to multitask and meet established deadlines
Self-motivated individual with excellent written and verbal communication skills
A willingness to work both independently and in a team-oriented environment
Able to work with little supervision and meet deadlines on a consistent basis

ranking2.title: Business Intelligence Analyst II
ranking2.Main Responsibilities:
Understand the assigned company processes, drivers, complexities, and operational requirements
Evaluate current Business Intelligence needs including upgrades and new product development
Drive innovation, process optimization, and critical/analytical thinking with stakeholders and leaders
Be the technical representative that stakeholders and leaders can use to interpret and develop new or existing insights
Take initiative in recommending data driven solutions to best serve future business needs
Use technical tools such as SQL, R, Python, and/or Power BI to develop compelling stories that can drive positive business outcomes
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, and break down high-level information into details
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analyses, and task/workflow analysis
Successfully engage in multiple simultaneous initiatives
Proactively communicate and collaborate with internal customers to analyze information needs, functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Business Requirements Document, Use Cases, product requirements documents, written reports, dashboards, and other visual reports used to operate the business
Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts
Manage projects and coordinate solutions
Ensure all products, artifacts, and analytics produced by yourself meet quality standards
ranking2.Position Requirements:
Intermediate experience with ANSI and Microsoft T SQL
The ability to explain data and analytical findings to colleagues all levels of the organization and of varied technical backgrounds
Experience with data visualization products including Tableau or similar, Power BI preferably
Working knowledge of procedural and object-oriented programing languages. Preferably, python, Scala, or R. Also, an intermediate knowledge of C/C++/Java/C# is acceptable
Conceptual understanding internet technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and SOAP/REST APIs
Conceptual understanding of Data and Systems security
The ability to build applications, reports, and analytics that adhere to data and system security standards
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft productivity tools including Power Point, Word, and Excel
The ability to interpret financial and operational data
The ability to solve complex problems
Excellent communication and presentation skills to stakeholders, team members, and customers
Minimum of a 4 Year / Bachelors Degree In a relevant field. Bachelor of Science (BS, B.Tech, etc.) in a mathematically intensive field like Computer Science, Statistics, Data Analytics, Economics, Software Development, Engineering, IT (if technical), Mathematics, etc.
Minimum of 3 years’ experience writing SQL queries and stored procedures
3 years’ experience with data enterprise visualization platforms such as MS Power BI, Tableau, or similar
3 years’ experience with structured software programing languages (Python, R etc.)
1 year experience solving complex business needs in the role of business analyst, business process manager, business architect, or other technical expert company leaders leverage for answers to complex technical questions

ranking3.title: Data Analyst MS Dynamics, Oracle Fusion Watsonville, CA 40391
ranking3.Position Requirements:
A solid background in data purification, extraction, review, and loading for Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP systems, as well as testing data conversion between Microsoft Dynamics and Oracle Fusion, is required of the ideal applicant
The candidate must have experience creating data cleansing strategies and deploying Oracle Utilities and Oracle Data Conversion tools including FBDI and HDL templates

ranking4.title: Data Analyst (Remote)
ranking4.Main Responsibilities:
Performs data analysis, interpretation and management duties
Develops rules and methodologies for data collection and analysis
Ensures the integrity of project data, including data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing and analysis
Consults with the external clients and internal staff to determine data management needs and objectives
May be responsible for database design, administration, security, and maintenance
Prepares presentations that reflect the results of the data analysis
Provides data-related training to staff
Coordinates with scientists and other technical experts to design and develop statistical analyses methodologies
Maintains current knowledge of relevant technologies as assigned
Participates in special projects as required
ranking4.Position Requirements:
2-5 years of related statistics/data analysis experience
Experience with R and/or SAS
Bachelors Degree (Master's Degree preferred) in a Computer Science, Statistics or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications or training, or work experience

ranking5.title: Biostatistician (SAS/MPH)
ranking5.Main Responsibilities:
Utilizing SAS programming expertise to acquire and analyze personnel and health data for epidemiological studies
Assisting in planning, designing, analyzing, and reporting on epidemiological studies
Supporting Senior Managing Epidemiologists and other personnel in AFHSD with biostatistical expertise
Providing consultative support on a wide variety of epidemiological and health surveillance questions including survey design, data analysis, technical writing, and public health recommendations for epidemiological consultations provided to stakeholders in the Army
Responding to requests for information from stakeholders throughout the Army and DoD
Assessing and ensuring the accuracy and quality of these products to include writing and reviewing SAS code
Providing epidemiological expertise and mentorship to and collaborating with other agencies on a wide variety of epidemiological projects
Collecting, monitoring, analyzing, interpreting, and summarizing morbidity and mortality surveillance data for the purposes of supporting behavioral health surveillance efforts for the U.S Army and the DoD
Disseminating the results of analytical studies via technical reports, briefings, presentations, manuscripts, websites and other media based on target audiences
ranking5.Position Requirements:
Master's degree in Biostatistics, Epidemiology or related field
3+ years of experience in SAS Coding
Experience using independent judgement and advanced knowledge of applied epidemiology
Has the ability to write and review SAS code for Public Health
Requires US Citizenship
Ability to obtain a Secret clearance

ranking6.title: Data Analyst, Strategic Partnerships( Bangkok based)
ranking6.Main Responsibilities:
In this role, you’ll get to:
Strategy: Conduct analyses to identify growth opportunities and prioritize investment areas in APAC for Strategic Partnerships team based on analytical insights, industry trends, and changing competitive landscape
Analytics: Leverage data & tools to analyze SP performance and identify appropriate levers to improve performance
Cross-functional projects: Work with different teams inside SP (B2B, White Label, Affiliates, Financial Institutions, different markets across APAC, etc.) and outside of SP (product, marketing, supply, finance, etc.) to drive initiatives
Performance management: Maintain and optimize a performance management system for the department, including a large team of account managers
Data & tools: Oversee SP data infrastructure to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness. Design, manage, and oversee the maintenance of data tools to support decision making
Performance reporting: Preparing updates on business performance, proposals, and recommendations to senior management
Pricing Experiments: Optimize pricing strategy and make decisions based on A/B experiments
ranking6.Position Requirements:
4 years and above of experience with Consulting, Data Analytics, Strategy, Business Development, Business Intelligence, or other relevant fields
Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems and come up with recommendations
Growth mindset and excited to work on a variety of functional areas
Entrepreneurial and not afraid to be hands-on on the work
Experience working in a fast-paced and high growth environment 
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with ability to work well across multiple stakeholders

ranking7.title: Senior Tableau Consultant
ranking7.Main Responsibilities: This candidate must possess technical, business analysis, and communication skills. This position offers an opportunity to work directly with business teams to design strategic solutions that visualize complex data in a focused manner. This individual will work closely with customers to gather requirements, prototype designs, and develop the final deliverable. Familiarity with the Tableau architecture and best practices is a must
ranking7.Position Requirements:
6+ years experience with implementing Tableau solutions
Experience with the Tableau Desktop & Tableau Prep
Expertise in dashboard and data visualization design
Advanced skills in data analysis and data discovery
Experience with Tableau Server or Tableau Cloud
Tableau Administration experience with security & permissions
Strong communication skills: ability to lead IT architecture design sessions and/or business dashboard working sessions
Strong SQL, relational database, & data warehousing skills
Experience with REST APIs is a plus
Industry experience in Retail, Finance, Supply Chain, Pharmaceuticals, and/or Manufacturing
Agile development experience is a plus
Experience with Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database is a plus
Experience with Matillion, Fivetran, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue is a plus

ranking8.title: Data Governance Analyst
ranking8.Main Responsibilities:
Work with lines of business to identify and solve data integrity and quality issues, recommend data quality improvement opportunities, and establish metrics for tracking performance of critical data elements
Build Frameworks for Data Governance, Data Quality and Data Stewardship efforts
Work with customers to align Use Cases and business initiatives with technical capabilities
Assist with policies, procedures and standards for information management throughout its lifecycle
Continuously improve and automate data management workflows
Recommend deployment of tools to monitor and control data quality to business data owners and determine the level of business impact for data quality issues
Facilitate and arbitrate data issue resolution and conflicts across business stakeholders by standardizing definitions, data requirements and quality standards
Design and recommend data quality issue remediation and escalation processes
Provide data management and governance guidance and best practices for Modern technologies like Big Data and Cloud technologies
Assist lines of business with interpreting data, writing business and data requirements and creating reports
Explore innovative tools and technology, evaluate new systems and keep up to speed with industry
Analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations
Monitor and maintain the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata
Help set/inform standards and compliance for Data Security and Privacy
Understanding of Master Data Management (MDM) and tools like Informatica, Semarchy, Reltio, Riversand, etc...
